question: Will there be a named tropical system Wanda that forms before November 1st, 2021?
description: This is a market on whether the 21st named storm (Wanda) for the NOAA Atlantic/Caribbean/Gulf of Mexico Region will form before 11:59:59 PM ET on October 31, 2021. This market will resolve according to official National Hurricane Center advisories. This market will resolve to "Yes" if Wanda forms between the launch of this market, October 7, 11 PM ET, and the end date, and “No” otherwise.

question: (In-Game Trading) Will the Jets or Falcons win their week five matchup?
description: This is a market on whether the New York Jets or the Atlanta Falcons will win their NFL week five matchup scheduled to take place on October 10, 2021, at 9:30 AM ET. This market will resolve to “Jets” if the Jets win. If the Falcons win, it will resolve to “Falcons.” If the match is postponed to a date on or before November 10, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. If the match is postponed to a date after November 10, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 61-39 in favor of “Falcons.”

question: (In-Game Trading) Will the Buccaneers beat the Dolphins by more than 10.5 points in their week five matchup?
description: This is a market on whether the Tampa Bay Buccaneers will beat the Miami Dolphins by over 10.5 points in their NFL week five matchup scheduled to take place on October 10, 2021, at 1:00 PM ET. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the Buccaneers win by over 10.5 points, and “No” if the Dolphins lose by less than 10.5 points or win. If the match is postponed to a date on or before November 11, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. If the match is postponed to a date after November  11, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 55-45 in favor of “No.”

question: Will the Rays or Red Sox win their ALDS matchup?
description: This market will resolve to “Rays” if the Tampa Bay Rays win their MLB American League Division Series. If the Red Sox win, it will resolve to “Red Sox.” The Rays v. Red Sox ALDS is scheduled to be held from October 7 to October 13, 2021. If the series is postponed to a date on or before November 13, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. If the match is postponed to a date after November 13, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 53-47 in favor of “Rays.”

question: Will the 7-day COVID-19 case average on November 17th be higher than it was a week earlier?
description:
This is a market on whether the United States will report a 7-day average of COVID-19 cases for the date of November 17th that is higher than the 7-day average of COVID-19 cases reported for the date of November 10th. This market will resolve on data from the CDC's Data Tracker, specifically, the 7-day moving average of COVID-19 cases for the United States, which is available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailytrendscases (navigate to "Select a state or territory" and select “United States”, and then scroll to "Data Table for Daily Case Trends" and view the data in the "7-Day Moving Avg" column, which is able to be sorted in descending order). 

The resolution source will be reviewed at 8 PM ET on November 24th to check the 7-day average for both the dates of November 17th and November 10th.  If the 7-day average for November 17th exceeds that of November 10th at this check, "Yes" will win.  Otherwise, "No" will win.  If the resolution source is unavailable at that time, the resolution source will be checked again at 8pm the following and each subsequent day until it is available. If the resolution source is unavailable by December 1, 2021, 8 PM ET, another credible source will be checked instead.
